SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE FOR SLACK INTEGRATIONS
Considerations for the Slack Conversations Component

Before you use the Slack Conversations component, make sure you understand its limitations.

Component Compatibility
You can add the Slack Conversations component to page layouts for only the objects that support Swarming.
You can see and interact with only the Slack channels that are linked to the record’s swarm. For example, if a swarm was started for a case, you can see the related Slack swarm channel conversation from the case’s Slack Conversations component.
Only public and private channels are supported in the Slack Conversations component. You can’t see direct messages or group messages from the component.
Users can see only the Slack channels that they have access to in Slack.
You can receive real-time messages from only the Slack channels that have the Service Cloud for Slack app installed.
The Slack Conversations component automatically resizes based on the page’s available space, but doesn’t account for Comfy or Compact display density changes by the user.
The Enter or Return key doesn’t send a Slack message from the Slack Conversations component. Use the Send button instead.
The Slack Conversations component doesn’t automatically redirect to the newest message for Firefox users.
You can’t send a thread reply to the rest of the Slack channel from the Slack Conversations component.
For optimal performance, don’t add more than two Slack Conversations components to your page layout.
Slack Actions
Using and creating Slack slash commands aren’t supported from the Slack Conversations component.
Using and creating Slack workflows aren’t supported from the Slack Conversations component.
Some Slack blocks, like actions, aren’t supported from the Slack Conversations component. To view a message’s unsupported block element, open the message in Slack.
Message Formatting
You can send, receive, and view Slack messages from the Slack Conversations component in Lightning Experience.
You can @mention Slack users from the Slack Conversations component. When @mentioning the user, you see their availability status as set in Slack.
You can @mention only Slack users with a linked Salesforce account from the Slack Conversations component.
@here and @Everyone aren’t supported from the Slack Conversations component.
To @mention a Slack channel from the Slack Conversations component, enter # followed by the channel name. You can mention only the Slack channels that you have access to.
To send an emoji from the Slack Conversations component, enter : followed by the emoji’s short name.
The Slack Conversations component doesn’t support partial formatting. For example, if part of a message is bolded but the rest isn’t, the message appears as unbolded.
Nested lists, inline code, code blocks, block quotes, and date formatting aren’t supported for outbound messages from the Slack Conversations component.
Attachments
You can upload, send, preview, and download attachments from the Slack Conversations component.
You can upload an attachment of up to 3 MB from the Slack Conversations component.
To preview an attachment sent from Slack, from the Slack Conversations component, find, and download the file.
Deleting an attachment from Slack also deletes it from the Slack Conversations component. You can’t delete an attachment from the Slack Conversations component.
